meanings.definition: Too small or unimportant to be worth consideration
meanings.sent1: The ant's size was insignificant compared to the elephant.
meanings.sent2: The tiny scratch on the car was insignificant and easily overlooked.
meanings.sent3: The student's excuse for not doing homework was so insignificant that it made the teacher chuckle.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, our problems seem insignificant like a grain of sand on a beach.
meanings.sent5: The impact of her words was so insignificant that they were soon forgotten.

meanings.sent1: The random scribbles on the paper were insignificant and held no value.
meanings.sent2: The old toy had become insignificant to the child as they grew older.
meanings.sent3: The argument over the last cookie seemed so insignificant once they found a whole jar of them.
meanings.sent4: His absence at the party was like an insignificant missing puzzle piece in the grand picture.
meanings.sent5: The background noise was so insignificant that it faded into the silence of the room.
